untrustedWorkspaces.description: The Python extension is not available in untrusted workspaces. Use Pylance to get partial IntelliSense support for Python files.

connect.label: Attach by connecting to debugpy over a socket.

host.description: Hostname or IP address to connect to.

debugAdapterPath.description: Path (fully qualified) to the python debug adapter executable.

host.description: Hostname or IP address to connect to.

justMyCode.description: If true, show and debug only user-written code. If false, show and debug all code, including library calls.

listen.label: Attach by listening for incoming socket connection from debugpy

host.description: Hostname or IP address of the interface to listen on.

logToFile.description: Enable logging of debugger events to a log file.

anyOf.description: Use process picker to select a process to attach, or Process ID as integer.
ID of the local process to attach to.

showReturnValue.description: Show return value of functions when stepping.

subProcess.description: Whether to enable Sub Process debugging

args.description: Command line arguments passed to the program.

autoReload.description: Configures automatic reload of code on edit.

exclude.description: Glob patterns of paths to exclude from auto reload.

include.description: Glob patterns of paths to include in auto reload.

console.description: Where to launch the debug target: internal console, integrated terminal, or external terminal.

consoleTitle.description: Display name of the debug console or terminal

cwd.description: Absolute path to the working directory of the program being debugged. Default is the root directory of the file (leave empty).

debugAdapterPath.description: Path (fully qualified) to the python debug adapter executable.

env.description: Environment variables defined as a key value pair. Property ends up being the Environment Variable and the value of the property ends up being the value of the Env Variable.

envFile.description: Absolute path to a file containing environment variable definitions.

gevent.description: Enable debugging of gevent monkey-patched code.

host.description: IP address of the of the local debug server (default is localhost).

logToFile.description: Enable logging of debugger events to a log file.

module.description: Name of the module to be debugged.

port.description: Debug port (default is 0, resulting in the use of a dynamic port).

purpose.description: Tells extension to use this configuration for test debugging, or when using debug-in-terminal command.

enumDescriptions: Use this configuration while debugging tests using test view or test debug commands.
Use this configuration while debugging a file using debug in terminal button in the editor.

python.description: Absolute path to the Python interpreter executable; overrides workspace configuration if set.

pythonArgs.description: Command-line arguments passed to the Python interpreter. To pass arguments to the debug target, use "args".

showReturnValue.description: Show return value of functions when stepping.

subProcess.description: Whether to enable Sub Process debugging

sudo.description: Running debug program under elevated permissions (on Unix).

editor/content.when: showCreateEnvButton && resourceFilename == pyproject.toml && pipInstallableToml && !virtualWorkspace && shellExecutionSupported  && !inDiffEditor && !isMergeResultEditor && pythonDepsNotInstalled

editor/context.when: editorLangId == python && !virtualWorkspace && shellExecutionSupported && isWorkspaceTrusted && !inChat  && notebookType != jupyter-notebook

viewsWelcome.contents:
Configure a test framework to see your tests here.
[Configure Python Tests](command:python.configureTests)

languageModelTools.name: get_python_environment_details
languageModelTools.modelDescription: This tool will retrieve the details of the Python Environment for the specified file or workspace. The details returned include the 1. Type of Environment (conda, venv, etec), 2. Version of Python, 3. List of all installed packages with their versions. ALWAYS call configure_python_environment before using this tool.

resourcePath.description: The path to the Python file or workspace to get the environment information for.

languageModelTools.name: get_python_executable_details
languageModelTools.modelDescription: This tool will retrieve the details of the Python Environment for the specified file or workspace. ALWAYS use this tool before executing any Python command in the terminal. This tool returns the details of how to construct the fully qualified path and or command including details such as arguments required to run Python in a terminal. Note: Instead of executing `python --version` or `python -c 'import sys; print(sys.executable)'`, use this tool to get the Python executable path to replace the `python` command. E.g. instead of using `python -c 'import sys; print(sys.executable)'`, use this tool to build the command `conda run -n <env_name> -c 'import sys; print(sys.executable)'`. ALWAYS call configure_python_environment before using this tool.

resourcePath.description: The path to the Python file or workspace to get the executable information for. If not provided, the current workspace will be used. Where possible pass the path to the file or workspace.

languageModelTools.name: install_python_packages
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Installs Python packages in the given workspace. Use this tool to install packages in the user's chosen environment. ALWAYS call configure_python_environment before using this tool.

packageList.description: The list of packages to install.

resourcePath.description: The path to the Python file or workspace into which the packages are installed. If not provided, the current workspace will be used. Where possible pass the path to the file or workspace.

languageModelTools.name: configure_python_environment
languageModelTools.modelDescription: This tool configures a Python environment in the given workspace. ALWAYS Use this tool to set up the user's chosen environment and ALWAYS call this tool before using any other Python related tools or running any Python command in the terminal.

resourcePath.description: The path to the Python file or workspace for which a Python Environment needs to be configured.

languageModelTools.name: create_virtual_environment
languageModelTools.modelDescription: This tool will create a Virual Environment

packageList.description: The list of packages to install.

resourcePath.description: The path to the Python file or workspace for which a Python Environment needs to be configured.

languageModelTools.name: selectEnvironment
languageModelTools.modelDescription: This tool will prompt the user to select an existing Python Environment

resourcePath.description: The path to the Python file or workspace for which a Python Environment needs to be configured.

scripts.package: gulp clean && gulp prePublishBundle && vsce package -o ms-python-insiders.vsix
scripts.testJediLSP: node ./out/test/languageServers/jedi/lspSetup.js && cross-env CODE_TESTS_WORKSPACE=src/test VSC_PYTHON_CI_TEST_GREP='Language Server:' node ./out/test/testBootstrap.js ./out/test/standardTest.js && node ./out/test/languageServers/jedi/lspTeardown.js
